result.execSummary:
The defendant Josh Peter Preuss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Serve 195 days in the county jail, to be served in any county jail that will accept and with work release.

Defendant is not to possess or consume alcohol.  Must submit to testing of blood, breath or urine on demand by law enforcement to monitor compliance.  

No bars/taverns or any establishment with primary purpose of sale of alcohol.  

AODA and any other programming and/or treatment at the discretion of the agent.

Pay costs of supervision.  All costs owed to the Court were removed from bond.

miscConds.notes: Paid out of bond.  Balance is $0.
Blood draw reimbursement cost due to Richland County for blood draw taken by Sheriff's Department.  Paid out of bond.  Balance due $0.

timeConds.notes: With work release/huber.  Jail may be served in any Wisconsin county jail that will accept.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Josh Peter Preuss

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: RCSD dispo of warrant or commitment for time served

Defendant Josh Peter Preuss appeared with Attorney Peter K. Lawrence. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 16CF52, 16TR465, 466, 467, and 468 called together.  DA states that the parties have an agreement for resolution; def to be pleading to the felony 16CF52 for a probation dispo that includes 195 days conditional time.  Def pleads no contest to the single count in 16CF52.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  

Def concedes three priors.  Discussion on priors:  Court notes complaint indicates four priors.  Counsel indicate that one of those dates listed in the complaint is the result of an erroneous entry; state that the def has three priors.  DA has noted that, since this case, however, def picked up another in Vernon County.

Sentence:  withheld for 3 years probation.  Conditions:  serve 6 1/2 months (195 days) in jail, can be served in any jail that will admit; 3 years revocation; 3 years IID upon relicensing; $600 plus costs (total of $1819); blood draw reimbursement of $69 to Richland County; AODA/driver safety plan to be relicensed (Atty. L states that one has already been done).  Submit DNA sample.  Fine/costs to come out of bond.  

Felony firearm admonishments provided.
Status conference on September 2, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Josh Peter Preuss in court with attorney Peter K. Lawrence. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  16CF52 called together with TR cases 465, 466, 467, and 468.  In the CF case, prelim waived with colloquy; information filed.  Atty. L requests status in all matters; states he and DA have been in early negotiations.  TR cases continue to track with CF.  Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Peter K. Lawrence in court for Defendant Josh Peter Preuss. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Several cases called together:  16CF52, 16TR467, 16TR466, 16TR468, and 16TR465.  Counsel request adj. of these matters.  Court sets 6/29 at 9.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Peter K. Lawrence in court for Defendant Josh Peter Preuss. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Status given, amended complaint was to be filed as of today's date. Court notes no amended complaint has been filed. Reset for June 1.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Josh Peter Preuss in court with attorney Peter K. Lawrence. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court states the charge and informs def of the possible max. penalties.  Court notes that the charge is stated as a misdemeanor in the complaint.  DA filed the case as a felony; states there is still uncertainty as to whether this is a misdemeanor or felony charge as the charge may actually be an OWI 5th.  Atty. Lawrence asks that the def be allowed to appear by counsel's authorization next time, despite fact of being a possible felony case.  Atty. Lawrence notes $2500 cash has been posted; asks for modification to signature bond.  Court leaves bond as previous set and posted.  4/21 at 1:30 for AIA, for determination as to the proper charges in the complaint.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
